s0301: Thirty-sixth year, Duke Mu again treated Meng Ming and others generously, had them lead troops to attack Jin, crossed the Yellow River and burned the boats, greatly defeated the Jin people, took Wangguan and Xiang, to avenge the Xiao defeat.
s0302: The Jin people all defended their cities and dared not come out.
s0303: Therefore Duke Mu personally crossed the Yellow River at Maojin, buried the corpses in Xiao, held mourning rites, wept for three days.
s0304: He swore to the army saying: 'Alas, soldiers!
s0305: Listen without clamor, I swear to tell you.
s0306: The ancients planned with white-haired elders, then had no errors.'
s0307: To show I reflect on not using Jian Shu and Bai Li Xi's plans, therefore I make this oath, to let later generations remember my errors.
s0308: Gentlemen who heard of it all shed tears, saying: 'Alas!
s0309: Duke Mu of Qin's dealings with people are so magnanimous, in the end he received Meng Ming's blessings.'
s0311: Thirty-seventh year, Qin used You Yu's plan to attack the Rong king, increased the state by twelve, opened territory a thousand li, thus became hegemon of the western Rong.
s0312: The Son of Heaven sent Zhao Gong to congratulate Duke Mu with metal drums.
s0314: Duke Mu's son was Duke Kang.
s0315: Duke Kang of Qin first year, attacked the Quanrong.
s0335: Twenty-first year, Duke Kang died, his son Duke Gong ascended.
s0336: Duke Gong of Qin first year, attacked the Quanrong.
s0352: Seventeenth year, Duke Gong died, his son Duke Huan ascended.
s0353: Duke Huan of Qin first year, attacked the Quanrong.
